newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia stocks open flat as budget digested.
newsitem.headline: Australia stocks open flat as budget digested.

text.p: The Australian share market was steady at the open on Wednesday with turnover returning to modest levels as the market digested Tuesday's 1996/97 budget.
At open, the All Ordinaries index firmed 0.3 points to 2,265.0 while September share index futures rose seven points to 2,277, a 12.0 point premium to the underlying index.
Brokers said activity was likely to remain steady as players examined the equity market implications of the budget, although early indications were that it had been reasonably well received.
"It's looking okay so far," said dealer Duncan Gamble of brokerage Wilson HTM.
"There's not great activity and there is some digesting of the budget going on but people are generally pretty confident about the market after the budget," he said.
Expectations were for a generally steady day's trading with a single figure finish the likely prospect.
Commonwealth Bank was an early performer, gaining ground after reporting a 16.6 percent higher full year pre-tax profit of A$1.78 billion.
Falls outnumbered rises by a ratio of about six to five, while about 47 percent of stocks traded remained steady.
